page.title: 15COMMERCIAL FRUIT GROWING
page.content: { Fruit growing}is the second largest land use in this block,with{apples}as the main crop.There are four extensive orchards where the fruit produced is sold commercially. Examples of the fruit grown are Cox's Orange Pippin, Worcester and Bramley. The Grade 1 apples are marketed at Birmingham, Bristol, and Cardiff or are bought by co-operatives for distribution to supermarkets around the country. The smaller fruit is sold for{cider making However, there are still many true {cider apple trees,}especially in{Aston {Ingham}together with some{cider pears. Some fruit also goes to the jam factories. Most of the farms and cottages have apple,plum and pear trees and sell the fruit from the door. Soft fruits are grown as a secondary crop. Top quality fruit goes to hotel trade.
